title: IEM shows that Athene's was massively over nerfed.
body:
Pretty much everyone just builds Morellonomicon instead, even against assassins like Fizz. Riot nerfed Athene's because they thought that it limited item diversity. Well now everyone merely builds a different item instead and there is still no diversity in AP item purchases.

Morellonomicon has more regen, more AP, is 600 gold cheaper and has a situationally powerful and underated grievous wounds effect. Meanwhile all Athene's has over Morellonomicon now is a mediocre amount of Magic resist.

I think that the items are currently in a decent spot in terms of stats, with Athene's being a more defensive item and Morellonomicon being a more offensive item. The main problem is that the cost disparity is way too high. To solve this i would suggest slighly reducing the cost of Athenes to 2500 and slightly increasing the cost of Morellonomicon to 2300. This way there might actually be a reasonable choice rather than Morellonomicon automatically being the superior option.

Edit according to lol Wiki
Statistical Value

80 ability power = 1740g                                 
100% base mana regeneration = 720g
20% cooldown reduction = 633g
Total Gold Value = 3093g

60 ability power = 1305g
25 magic resist = 500g
50% mana regen = 360g
20% cooldown reduction = 633g
Total Gold Value = 2798g
(The new Athene's passive is significantly worse than 50% base mana regen  so its safe to assume its gold value is roughly around 250g, even with this passive included Morellonomicon's stats have a higher gold value)

Mana Font: Mages average between 1100-1200 Mana at level 18. If you have 0 Mana you gain 18 regen, if you have 50% mana you have 9 regen. The extra 50% base mana regen on Morellonomicon gives you 10 mana regen AT ALL times at level 18.


Morellonomicon is way too gold efficient.

{{item:3165}}  was always massively gold efficient, way before {{item:3174}} got nerfed. I think the change in preference has more to do with the changes to mana regen: before Preseason 5, Morellonomicon and Athene's had the same amount of flat mana regen, except AUG also had Mana Font and its regen-on-kill/assist passive. Now Morellonomicon's 100% base mana regen is a buff to its late-game regeneration, whereas AUG's 50% base mana regen and different Mana Font passive makes it a less attractive choice for early game mana sustain.

While Morellonomicon perhaps needs a price increase, I think Athene's has more of a problem here: for all intents and purposes, it's pretty much a Morellonomicon that trades 20 AP for 25 MR (or, alternatively, Morellonomicon is an AUG that ditches the small amount of MR for a more straightforward AP boost), so they're both competing for the same niche. When AUG is strong, Morellonomicon gets rarely picked, and vice versa. However, from the past seasons AUG was a consistent mage pick because of how {{item:3028}} was practically compulsory to getting an edge in lane. Its MR allowed you to take less poke, and its mana regen allowed you to poke without having to worry too much about mana conservation, so an AP-versus-AP mid lane tended to be an arms race where the first one to get a Chalice could out-perform their opponent on every level. Grail exacerbated those issues by letting the wielder cast stronger spells a lot more frequently, all while mitigating the enemy's magic damage. Making Grail the dominant pick again would just reinstate the arms race, whereas the build path for Morellonomicon doesn't immediately solve the wielder's mana issues, nor does it guarantee defense against the enemy's damage.

I made a thread about my feelings on the issue so I wont go too in depth but the issue I think they had with Athenes is that items are a bad/lazy way to fix the mana management issue.  Not all champions are equally in need of a resource fix.  Champions at the top end of the mage meta, like Syndra or Orianna, have very manageable mana cost and low cooldowns.  Champions like Lux or Malzahar who are yet to have their kits modernized were the intended recipients but the item to make them viable had to be so powerful it became a staple for a huge swathe of mid laners.

tl/dr: They need to go through and dramatically reduce the cost of mage abilities in second and lower tiers.  It will take way longer and be way more work but if you use an item fix then a buff to a tier 4 mage will also buff a tier 1 mage.

I at no point said they can't go OOM.  I said that they have manageable costs and cooldowns.  This means that they can use their abilities to poke and clear to a reasonable level without a ton of mana regen and their cooldowns are not prohibitively long (3 second CD/50 mana Q for Orianna and 4 second/40-80 mana Q for Syndra).    

There is a reason these champions are top tier and these values are a big contributing factor.  Compare this to Lux main waveclear/poke in lane at 70-130 mana per cast and 10 second cooldown at all levels or Malzahar's DoT spell which is 60-120 mana and scales from a huge 15 second cooldown at level one to 7 seconds at level five.  Doing a full rotation of spells on Zilean costs 565 mana using a single time warp whereas a full Syndra combo is 330.

Basically the idea is that in an age of Zeds and Syndras there is a certain expectation of availability when it comes to spells.  Every champion they will release from this point on will have some sort of mechanic you constantly employ from level one on and Athenes was designed to push mages into the modern era all at once.  The problem is that some champions only needed a little help (tier 1) while others needed a lot (tier 2 and below).  Using an item fix is inappropriate to the challenge.

At level 18 Syndra, for example, has 1184 mana
At level 1 she has 6 mp5 with a growth scaling of 0.8 per level.  This means at level 18 Syndra has 19.6 base mp5
-------------------------
Morellonomicon will give an additional 19.6 mp5 at level 18, up to a total of 39.2 mp5 or 7.84 mana per second

Athenes will give an additional 9.8 mp5 at level 18, up to a total of 29.4 mp5 or 5.88 mana per second.  The breakpoint for Athenes providing more mana return is at (39.2 - 29.4) = (0.015)(missing mana), or missing mana = 653.33
-------------------------
653.33 mana is 55% of syndra's total mana pool.  This means for the tooltip-stated athenes to work at efficiency when compared to Morellonomicon.  This leaves 531 mana for syndra to work with in order to maintain item efficiency, but now let's look at her mana costs:

Dark Sphere - 80 Mana, Cooldown 4s (reduced by 25% with athenes + mastery = 3s)
Force of Will - 100 Mana
Scatter the Weak - 50 Mana
Unleashed Power - 100 Mana
------------------------------
Analysis:

I listed the cooldown of her Q because this is essentially Syndra's auto attack in the later stages of the game.  You can expect almost 100% uptime on this ability when it is off cooldown in fights.  All 3 abilities are often used for waveclear and poking.  330 mana is required for her 'full combo' and therefore must be conserved. 410 if you want to consider that most Syndra players will Q twice before ulting.  So this leaves, generously, about 854 mana that can be expended before Syndra is forced to stop using her abilities for a little while to regenerate.  

Keep in mind that when the value goes lower than 653.33 Athenes is no longer the efficient choice.  So you essentially have a 200 mana gap to work with between what is considered efficient use of athenes versus blowing your entire load and becoming useless for a really long time regardless of your mana regen item. 

With Athenes you get 42.21 mp5 if you are missing 854 mana.  The theoretical maximum.  With morellonomicon you have 100% uptime on 39.2 mp5.  So you tell me, which is better?  I think the answer is obvious.
